q: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
h:
“A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: To perceive is to suffer.
h:
“To perceive is to suffer.” —
Aristotle

q: Don't learn to do, but learn in doing.
h:
“Don't learn to do, but learn in doing.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Poetry is written with tears, fiction with blood, and history with invisible ink.
h:
“Poetry is written with tears, fiction with blood, and history with invisible ink.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.
h:
“If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.
h:
“Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.” —
Unknown

q: There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.
h:
“There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Make each day a new horizon.
h:
“Make each day a new horizon.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
h:
“Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.
h:
“Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.” —
Og Mandino

q: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
h:
“Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.
h:
“The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.” —
Socrates

q: You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.
h:
“You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.” —
Dan Millman

q: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
h:
“Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.
h:
“Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.” —
Aristotle

q: Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher.
h:
“Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.
h:
“Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.” —
Alan Watts

q: If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.
h:
“If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
h:
“There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.” —
Maya Angelou

q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.” —
Steve Jobs

q: There are no differences but differences of degree between different degrees of difference and no difference.
h:
“There are no differences but differences of degree between different degrees of difference and no difference.” —
William James

q: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.
h:
“Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.” —
Jack Kerouac

q: The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.
h:
“The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: When you want to be honored by others, you learn to honor them first.
h:
“When you want to be honored by others, you learn to honor them first.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.
h:
“Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.” —
Celestine Chua

q: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.
h:
“It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Your past does not equal your future.
h:
“Your past does not equal your future.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
h:
“Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: To be truly positive in the eyes of some, you have to risk appearing negative in the eyes of others.
h:
“To be truly positive in the eyes of some, you have to risk appearing negative in the eyes of others.” —
Criss Jami

q: Creative people are often found either disagreeable or intimidating by mediocrities.
h:
“Creative people are often found either disagreeable or intimidating by mediocrities.” —
Criss Jami

q: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.
h:
“My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?
h:
“Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone.
h:
“The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: If you try to get rid of fear and anger without knowing their meaning, they will grow stronger and return.
h:
“If you try to get rid of fear and anger without knowing their meaning, they will grow stronger and return.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.
h:
“Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
h:
“Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.” —
Les Brown

q: Realistic people do not accomplish extraordinary things.
h:
“Realistic people do not accomplish extraordinary things.” —
John Eliot

q: People who avoid failure also avoid success.
h:
“People who avoid failure also avoid success.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: The only difference between success and failure is the ability to take action.
h:
“The only difference between success and failure is the ability to take action.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Get mad, then get over it.
h:
“Get mad, then get over it.” —
Colin Powell

q: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
h:
“There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts.  Let it go. It is not serving you.
h:
“The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts. Let it go. It is not serving you.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.
h:
“Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.” —
Elvis Presley

q: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
h:
“He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.” —
Epictetus

q: The seasons do not push one another; neither do clouds race the wind across the sky. All things happen in their own good time.
h:
“The seasons do not push one another; neither do clouds race the wind across the sky. All things happen in their own good time.” —
Dan Millman

q: Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.
h:
“Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.
h:
“Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.” —
William James

q: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
h:
“To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all. ” —
Oscar Wilde
